Docs.param: The grove port(s).GROVE_1 and / or GROVE_2.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetMotorPositionKD (Iot.Device.GoPiGo3.Models.MotorPort port, byte kd = 70);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetMotorPositionKD(valuetype Iot.Device.GoPiGo3.Models.MotorPort port, unsigned int8 kd) cil managed
Public Sub SetMotorPositionKD (port As MotorPort, Optional kd As Byte = 70)
member this.SetMotorPositionKD : Iot.Device.GoPiGo3.Models.MotorPort * byte -> unit

Docs.param: The Motor port to use, can be MotorLeft and/or MotorRight
The KD constant (default 70)
Docs.summary: Set the motor target position KD constant If you set KP higher, the motor will be more responsive to errors in position, at the cost of perhaps overshooting and oscillating. KD slows down the motor as it approaches the target, and helps to prevent overshoot. In general, if you increase kp, you should also increase KD to keep the motor from overshooting and oscillating. See as well https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PID_controller

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetMotorPositionKP (Iot.Device.GoPiGo3.Models.MotorPort port, byte kp = 25);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetMotorPositionKP(valuetype Iot.Device.GoPiGo3.Models.MotorPort port, unsigned int8 kp) cil managed
Public Sub SetMotorPositionKP (port As MotorPort, Optional kp As Byte = 25)
member this.SetMotorPositionKP : Iot.Device.GoPiGo3.Models.MotorPort * byte -> unit

Docs.param: The Motor port to use, can be MotorLeft and/or MotorRight
The KP constant (default 25)
Docs.summary: Set the motor target position KP constant If you set KP higher, the motor will be more responsive to errors in position, at the cost of perhaps overshooting and oscillating. KD slows down the motor as it approaches the target, and helps to prevent overshoot. In general, if you increase KP, you should also increase KD to keep the motor from overshooting and oscillating. See as well https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PID_controller
